item.description: Create view view_fixed_stimes - view containing the correct start_times for the intermediate line and ju_exit_status.
item.sql: CREATE VIEW view_fixed_stimes AS SELECT u1.ju_parent, u1.ju_id, coalesce(max(u2.ju_end_time), u1.ju_start_time) AS fstart_time, u1.ju_end_time, CASE WHEN u1.ju_end_time = max(u3.ju_end_time) then u1.ju_exit_status ELSE -1 END AS fexit_status FROM sge_job_usage u1 LEFT OUTER JOIN sge_job_usage u2 ON u2.ju_parent = u1.ju_parent AND u2.ju_end_time < u1.ju_end_time LEFT OUTER JOIN sge_job_usage u3 ON u3.ju_parent = u1.ju_parent GROUP BY u1.ju_parent, u1.ju_id, u1.ju_start_time, u1.ju_end_time, u1.ju_exit_status ORDER BY u1.ju_parent, u1.ju_id

item.description: Update sge_job_usage with the correct ju_start_time values for intermediate lines and ju_exit_status.
item.sql: UPDATE sge_job_usage SET ju_start_time = n.fstart_time, ju_exit_status = n.fexit_status FROM view_fixed_stimes n WHERE sge_job_usage.ju_id = n.ju_id

item.description: Create view view_fixed_usages - view containing the correct usages (ju_cpu, ju_mem, ju_io, ju_iow) for the intermediate line.
item.sql: CREATE VIEW view_fixed_usages AS SELECT u1.ju_parent, u1.ju_id, 2*max(u2.ju_cpu) - sum(u2.ju_cpu) as ju_cpu, 2*max(u2.ju_mem) - sum(u2.ju_mem) as ju_mem, 2*max(u2.ju_io) - sum(u2.ju_io) as ju_io, 2*max(u2.ju_iow) - sum(u2.ju_iow) as ju_iow FROM sge_job_usage u1 LEFT OUTER JOIN sge_job_usage u2 ON u2.ju_parent = u1.ju_parent GROUP BY u1.ju_parent, u1.ju_id, u1.ju_cpu, u1.ju_mem, u1.ju_io, u1.ju_iow HAVING u1.ju_cpu = max(u2.ju_cpu) ORDER BY u1.ju_parent, u1.ju_id

item.description: Update sge_job_usage with the correct ju_cpu, ju_mem, ju_io, ju_iow values for the intermediate line
item.sql: UPDATE sge_job_usage SET ju_cpu = n.ju_cpu, ju_mem = n.ju_mem, ju_io = n.ju_io, ju_iow = n.ju_iow FROM view_fixed_usages n WHERE sge_job_usage.ju_id = n.ju_id
DROP VIEW view_fixed_stimes
DROP VIEW view_fixed_usages
